intro: Linanthus bakeri, commonly known as Baker's linanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. This annual plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Linanthus bakeri is considered a rare and endangered species.
